sentences.english: And hast borne, and hast patience, and for my name's sake hast laboured, and hast not fainted.
sentences.chinese: 你也能忍耐，曾爲我的名勞苦，並不乏倦。

sentences.english: Chinese book education has several precedents in our country from ancient times to the present.
sentences.chinese: 書冊教育在我國從古到今不乏先例。

sentences.english: It has been used repeatedly in history, not least by former U.S. President Richard Nixon.
sentences.chinese: 歷史上不乏先例，美國前總統尼克松就是其中之一。

sentences.english: Most footballers have an amazing body, but there are some who are really chubby.
sentences.chinese: 足球運動員多數都身材不錯，但也不乏胖子。

sentences.english: Scholars advocating the preservation and scholars advocating the abolition both exist.
sentences.chinese: 主張保留和廢除的學者都不乏其人。

sentences.english: Others are latching on to that growth story.
sentences.chinese: 正在投資亞洲增長題材的不乏其人。

sentences.english: But others are courageously optimistic about its ability to adapt.
sentences.chinese: 但對香港電影業適應力持積極樂觀態度者也不乏其人。

sentences.english: Of course, there are some important caveats.
sentences.chinese: 當然，其中不乏嚴重警告的信號。

sentences.english: People published a lot of views to this one problem, there is no lack of among them genuine knowledge drinks see.
sentences.chinese: 人們對這一問題發表了許多看法，其中不乏真知酌見。

sentences.english: There are lots of phonies and charlatans in the financial newsletter business.
sentences.chinese: 幹金融通訊這一行的人中間不乏騙子和吹牛大王。

sentences.english: The learning effect is obvious to all, there's no lack of dummy English learners.
sentences.chinese: 其效果是有目共睹的，啞巴英語不乏其人。

sentences.english: There is no lack of anti-capitalism today.
I will also give him the morning star.
sentences.chinese: 你也能忍耐，曾爲我的名勞苦，並不乏倦。

sentences.english: Rich and confident in big chording, also supplying some delicate quiet contrasts.
sentences.chinese: 和絃豐滿而自信，也不乏寧靜細緻的對比。

sentences.english: Of course, there are some critical eyes the same love.
sentences.chinese: 當然，也不乏有些爆眼子同樣喜歡。

sentences.english: Lack the birds and the sound, people are never tired.
sentences.chinese: 不乏的是鳥兒的和音，讓人百聽不厭。

definition: there are plenty of such people
(used for abstract things) a good deal, a lot of
just a very few (idiom); tiny number/not many at all/You count them on your fingers.
too numerous to mention individually or one by one
more and more emerge/innumerable succession/breeding like flies (idiom)
as many as the hair of the ox (idiom)/great amount of/countless
